insight: Indian students in Rouen should bring small quantities of essential spices and mixes for the first few weeks. Avoid overpacking masalas and rice — most items are available at local stores like Lidl, Carrefour, and Triangle.

mustBring.name: Basic Indian Spice Kit
mustBring.tooltip: Bring turmeric, chili powder, mustard seeds, cumin, garam masala, etc., in small airtight packets.
mustBring.studentTip: Jay and Meghana overpacked spices; just 5–6 are enough for a month.

mustBring.name: Tamarind Paste / Rice Mixes
mustBring.tooltip: Not available in France. Bring enough for your needs.
mustBring.studentTip: Hari used them when he was tired after classes.

mustBring.name: Pickle (leak-proof jar)
mustBring.tooltip: Long shelf life and adds flavor to simple meals.
mustBring.studentTip: Meghana used pickle regularly when skipping cooking.

mustBring.name: Ready-to-Eat Meals (2–3 packs)
mustBring.tooltip: Useful during travel, airport transitions, or tired days.
mustBring.studentTip: Jay used these during the first week before grocery shopping.

optional.name: Small Dal & Rice Starter Pack
optional.tooltip: Not necessary, but helpful for first 1–2 meals.
optional.studentTip: Aslam brought a small packet to avoid grocery stress.

optional.name: Homemade Snacks / Namkeen
optional.tooltip: Good for emotional comfort in early days.
optional.studentTip: Meghana packed some homemade sweets and savories.

buyInFrance.name: Dal, Rice, Oil, Sugar, Salt
buyInFrance.tooltip: All are widely available at Lidl, Super U, and Carrefour.
buyInFrance.studentTip: Most students regretted packing bulk basics. Local prices are reasonable.

buyInFrance.name: Indian Spices (bulk refill)
buyInFrance.tooltip: After you settle, you can restock from Triangle or Indian stores.
buyInFrance.studentTip: Aslam switched to Triangle after paying more at specialty stores.

buyInFrance.name: Curry Leaves, Amla, Shallots
buyInFrance.tooltip: ❌ Rarely available in Rouen. Bring dried/frozen from India if needed.
buyInFrance.studentTip: Some students coordinated with Paris friends to source these.
